dataGroup.data: 31 m / 102 ft Waterproof Rugged Design Camera for Adventure Leisure
1. 31m / 102 ft waterproof rugged design boosting outdoor excitement
Dustproof, shockproof, freezeproof and pressure resistance
1,170k-dot equivalent LVF (Live View Finder) and 1,040k-dot rear monitor
4K PHOTO - 30 fps burst shooting in 8-megapixel equivalent resolution
High picture quality with 20.4-megapixel High Sensitivity MOS Sensor
1. 31m / 102 ft waterproof rugged design boosting outdoor excitement

The LUMIX FT7 boasts even more rugged design that enables waterproof to 31 m / 102 ft. Thanks to its minimum apertural area and the rubber padding and reinforced glass inside the camera, the LUMIX FT7 features an airtight body protected against water immersion, dust and sand. Body case is even more thickened to withstand high water pressure of 31m / 102ft.
Dustproof, shockproof, freezeproof and pressure resistance

The LUMIX FT7 also features dustproof, shockproof to 2 m / 6.6 ft, freezeproof to -10 degrees C / 14 degrees F and pressure resistance to 100 kgf / 220 lbf. Not only that, the LUMIX FT7 adopts compass and altimeter. Take out the camera to fishing or camping in the springtime, to diving, snorkeling, surfing in summer, or mountain climbing in autumn and to skiing or snowboarding in winter – The LUMIX FT7 is an all-year-round active field player to record stunning memories in beautiful photo and video.
1,170k-dot equivalent LVF (Live View Finder) and 1,040k-dot rear monitor

The LUMIX FT7 integrates a 0.2-inch 1,170k-dot equivalent LVF (Live View Finder). Now it is easier to capture subject even under strong sunlight or in backlighting. Using LVF also saves power consumption to achieve longer battery life in harsh conditions. The 3.0-inch rear monitor boasts highest-in-class 1,040k-dot resolution featuring approximately 100% field of view. The image output between the LVF and the rear monitor is switched with a dedicated button instantly. Tempered glass is adopted for the cover glass of LCD.
4K capability bringing the evolution in videography / photography – 4K video and 4K PHOTO

The LUMIX FT7 records stunningly smooth, high-resolution QFHD 4K video in 3840 x 2160 at 30p, 25p or 24p in MP4. Taking advantage of 4K technology, you can enjoy 4K PHOTO to capture those unmissable moments at 30 fps and save in 8-megapixel high resolution photos. The LUMIX FT7 also comes with the Post Focus function that enables you to select in-focus area even after shooting. High Speed Video enables recording subject with fast motion in HD (1280x720) at 100 fps.
High picture quality with 20.4-megapixel High Sensitivity MOS Sensor

The LUMIX FT7 integrates 20.4-megapixel High Sensitivity MOS sensor to achieve highest-in-class resolution. New sensor and the imaging engine realize high-speed response and high-speed burst shooting at 10 fps in full resolution with mechanical shutter and 5 fps with AF Tracking. The LUMIX FT7 incorporates a high-quality 28mm wide-angle LUMIX lens with a 4.6x optical zoom (35mm equivalent: 28-128mm) in folded optics. POWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer) effectively suppress handshake.
31m / 102ft Waterproof Rugged Design Camera with 4K Video, 4K PHOTO and High-resolution LVF
Featuring 4K capability and waterproofing to withstand a depth of 31 meters / 102 feet, this newly enhanced, highly versatile and durable camera can capture never-before images.
Freezeproof to -10 degrees C / 14 degrees F
1/2.3-type High Sensitivity MOS Sensor / 21.1 Total Megapixels

data.attributeName: Creating a Motion Picture from Still Pictures
data.transAttributeName: Creating a Motion Picture from Still Pictures

dataGroup.data: English, Chinese (Traditional), Chinese (Simplified), Thai, Arabic, Persian, Vietnamese
Auto, Auto/Red-eye Reduction, Forced On, Forced On/Red-eye Reduction, Slow Sync., Slow Sync./Red-eye Reduction, Forced Off
SD Memory Card, SDHC Memory Card, SDXC Memory Card
(Compatible with UHS-I UHS Speed Class 3 standard SDHC / SDXC Memory Cards)
・ The software to edit and playback images on computer is not bundled with this camera. Please use the software pre-installed to the PC or other general image viewing software to browse pictures.
Battery Pack, AC Adaptor, USB Cable, Hand Strap
・ Operating Instructions for advanced features is available for downloaded at Panasonic LUMIX Customer Support Site using PC, smartphone or tablet connected to the Internet.
- Temperature: 23 oC (73.4 oF) / Humidity: 50%RH when monitor is on.
- Using a Panasonic SDHC Memory Card
- Starting recording 30 seconds after the camera is turned on. (When the optical image stabilizer function is set to [ON].)
- Recording once every 30 seconds with full flash every second recording.
- Rotating the zoom lever from Tele to Wide or vice versa in every recording.
- The number of recordable pictures varies depending on the recording interval time.
- If the recording interval time becomes longer, the number of recordable pictures decreases.
- CIPA is an abbreviation of [Camera & Imaging Products Association].
*2 - Use a card with SD Speed Class with ""Class 4"" or higher when recording motion pictures.
- Use a card with SD Speed Class with ""UHS-I Speed Class 3 (U3)"" when recording motion pictures with [MP4] in [4K] [High Speed Video] or [4K PHOTO].
(SD speed class is the speed standard regarding continuous writing.)
- Recording stops when the continuous recording time exceeds 29 minutes and 59 seconds with [4K].
- When using an SDHC memory card: You can continue recording without interruption even if the file size exceeds 4 GB, but the motion picture file will be divided and recorded/played back separately.
- When using an SDXC memory card: You can record a motion picture in a single file.
- Recording stops when the continuous recording time exceeds 29 minutes and 59 seconds except [4K].
You can continue recording without interruption even if the file size exceeds 4 GB, but the motion picture file will be divided and recorded/played back separately.
- These are standard times taken at a temperature of 23 oC (73.4 oF) and a humidity of 50%RH.
- The time available for recording varies depending on the environment, the interval between recordings, and the manner of use.
- Actual recordable time is the time available for recording when repeating actions such as switching the power supply [ON] / [OFF], starting/stopping recording, zoom operation etc.
*3 For [4K] video output, use an HDMI cable that has the HDMI logo on it, and that is described as"4K compatible".
